name: trace_targets
description:
Traces A* paths between a list of target coordinates, avoiding obstacles and saving all reachable points to a file and a visualization image. At each checkpoint (the final point of each segment to a target), an optional delay (in milliseconds) can be written as a third CSV column for that point.

Output: Saves the improved path points to a text file (x,y or x,y,delay_ms at checkpoints) and renders a visual path overlay image with arena, obstacles, and path segments.

Example Usage: `trace_targets([(50,50), (150,150)], 'Targets/improved.txt', start=(10,10), data_folder='Data', spacing=5, delay=1500, out_path='Data/trace_overlay.png')` returns: Confirmation message indicating path generation success and saved file location.

input_target_list.description: Required. A list of (x,y) target coordinates. Provide as a list of lists or tuples, e.g., [[50, 50], [150, 150]].

output_target_path.description: Path to write the concatenated reachable points to a plain-text CSV file.

start.description: Optional start position (x, y). If not provided, the robot's current position from the data folder will be used.

data_folder.description: Folder containing arena data, obstacle files, and the camera frame image. Defaults to 'Data'.

spacing.description: Optional dilation spacing (in pixels) around obstacles to ensure safe A* navigation. Default 50.

delay.description: Optional delay (in milliseconds) to apply at EACH checkpoint. You may also pass an array of integers (one per target) if your caller supports non-scalar types; e.g., [1000, 0, 2000]. When provided, the delay is written only on the last point of each segment.

out_path.description: Path to save the output visualization PNG showing arena, obstacles, and traced paths.
